metadata.title: CVE-2021-4203 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - medium
metadata.description: A use-after-free read flaw was found in sock_getsockopt() innet/core/sock.c due to SO_PEERCRED and SO_PEERGROUPS race with listen()(and connect()) in the Linux kernel. In this flaw, an attacker with a userprivileges may crash the system or leak internal kernel information.

criterions.comment: linux: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
linux-lts-xenial: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
